programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry Weiss finds a miniature piano in a locker full of hair salon supplies, while Dave Hester makes a bid for a unit.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Items arriving in the show include an 1800s Colt revolver, an antique Chinese fingernail guard, a life mask of Abraham Lincoln and a Playboy magazine used in the movie Forrest Gump.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Madonna's 1988 day planner arrives at the shop, along with a 1910 phrenology head, but it remains to be seen which is the most valuable.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Everyone's eyes are on Seth as he tries to prove he is worthy of being in charge, while also attempting to keep calm as the pressure begins to mount.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth makes a costly mistake that threatens to land the business in financial disaster. While he tries to correct it, Ashley spills the beans to Les.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick gives a 1967 motorbike an overhaul, but finds refurbishing a 1940s mailbox is not as straightforward as he expected.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team tries to restore a 1960s motorbike ride and a damaged bumper car from the 1950s.

programme.title: UFO Europe
programme.desc: Unknown objects, weird lights and a shocking criminal investigation - check out Scotland's Livingston UFO, Norway's Hessdalen lights and Portugal's Castelo de Bode Dam encounter.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: The crime documentary series returns with a look at the murder of 67-year-old Alice Hufnagle, who was strangled to death by an intruder in her Pennsylvania home in 2002.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders visit state capital Austin, where Moe and Mary compete for a locker worth $8,000

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba demonstrate they have a mean side as tensions rise during the last day of auctions in Austin.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les works at breakneck pace to customise a $20,000 ring, but Seth is furious when Ashley unjustifiably derails the sale.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A customer is furious when Seth rumbles him for trying to flog fake goods. Later, panic grips the staff as a farmer lets an animal loose in the shop.

programme.title: The Great UFO Conspiracy
programme.desc: According to a 2012 survey, more people in the UK believe in the existence of aliens than in God, and more than a quarter of people think that evidence of UFOs has been covered up by the government. In this documentary, writer and comedian Dan Schreiber sets out to track down those behind the current ET conspiracy theories, meeting some of the biggest voices in the UFO community in an attempt to find out why so many people are captivated by extraterrestrial mysteries.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Between 1981 and 2011, cameras on Nasa space shuttles have picked up many images of UFOs that experts still struggle to explain.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos from Ancient Aliens investigates whether extra-terrestrial beings lie at the heart of some of Earth's most famous mysteries.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate stories of a French church that supposedly contains a gateway to another universe and an alien library believed to be hidden underneath the Great Sphinx of Giza.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick Dale and the team take on one of their biggest challenges when they repair a rusty horse-drawn fuel delivery wagon.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The staff from Pawn Stars bring Rick a challenging item to restore - a nuclear missile from the 1950s.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Among the oddities brought in is a 1950s toy lie detector, and Chum must decide whether to make an honest offer when he takes charge of the shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A shower curtain signed by Anthony Perkins from Alfred Hitchcock's classic 1960 thriller Psycho, arrives at the shop.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The experts head to Long Beach, California, where high-end imports and low-income housing mean that every unit is a risky purchase.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders visit an upmarket retirement community, where Darrell Sheets buys a unit filled with furniture, and Jarrod Schulz takes a gamble on a safe.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Jenny acquires inside information on a prized locker - and when she opens it, she discovers it contains information on a centuries-old secret society.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Victor makes a find that leads him to a basketball arena, while another bidder is not so successful and left desperate for revenge.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four previous competitors return to the forge for a second chance, only to find that the road to redemption is far from easy.

programme.title: Conspiracy Rising
programme.desc: An investigation into the causes of conspiracy theories, the people who believe them, and how we separate fantasies from real threats..

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: While many UFO sightings occur in rural locations with only a single eyewitness, there have been sightings over cities witnessed by hundreds.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos from Ancient Aliens investigates whether extra-terrestrial beings lie at the heart of some of Earth's most famous mysteries.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate whether common human rituals may have been inspired by contact with aliens.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley splashes out on a worthless roulette table, which sparks one of the biggest fights the Gold family has ever witnessed.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley returns to put Seth in his place. Meanwhile, a customer who has been robbed looks to sell her last remaining possession.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders take a risk on units in a Californian town rich in Spanish-American culture.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Midnight in the Gardena Good and Evil
programme.desc: Barry Weiss hires a psychic to tell him what he thinks is inside a locker and help him decide whether to purchase its contents.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team is intrigued when handwritten lyrics to My Country, 'Tis of Thee arrive at the shop, but it remains to be seen whether they are the real deal.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An autographed picture of John Belushi and a Jim Henson puppet arrive in the shop, but it remains to be seen if any of them are worth big money.

programme.title: Mega Pit Stops
programme.desc: A look at how enormous vehicles, such as planes, trains and ships, are repaired and returned to service within incredibly short timeframe.

programme.title: Ultimate Vehicles
programme.desc: The milestones of engineering that have changed land, water, and air transport for good. This episode focuses on civil aircraft.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The experts head to Long Beach, California, where high-end imports and low-income housing mean that every unit is a risky purchase.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders visit an upmarket retirement community, where Darrell Sheets buys a unit filled with furniture, and Jarrod Schulz takes a gamble on a safe.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts a special edition that poses questions on all manner of inventions, including some that proved to be 'just the job'. Trying to come up with interesting answers are Top Gear presenter Jeremy Clarkson, comedian Jason Manford, broadcaster Sandi Toksvig and regular panellist Alan Davies.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Rob Beckett, Gary Delaney, Ed Gamble, Rhys James and Zoe Lyons join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation. First shown in July 2016.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts another round of the peculiar panel quiz and finds out how much Julia Zemiro, Tim Vine, Rob Brydon and regular panellist Alan Davies know about the theme of jolly, awarding points for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts a special edition that poses questions on all manner of inventions, including some that proved to be 'just the job'. Trying to come up with interesting answers are Top Gear presenter Jeremy Clarkson, comedian Jason Manford, broadcaster Sandi Toksvig and regular panellist Alan Davies.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Comedian Chris Ramsey and broadcasters Anita Rani, Janet Ellis and Jamie Theakston continue the daily test of their general knowledge skills. Hosted by Richard Osman.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Rob Beckett, Gary Delaney, Ed Gamble, Rhys James and Zoe Lyons join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation. First shown in July 2016.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim Warwood and Adam Gendle take downhill mountain-bike racing to the next level by adding more wheels.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Keith gets lost on the roads of Derbyshire looking for a wanted man. He spots a dodgy van driver who is on the road without insurance, and is forced to make a crucial decision.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank uncover an impressive hoard, and strike gold in an unusual prop shop.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: The Alvarados take a gamble and Tarrell 'T-Money' Wright lands an interesting item. Plus, Brandon Bernier hopes to make an impact on the bidding for several storage units.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori strike it rich, and 'T-Money' takes risks while bidding.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank get behind the wheel of the original Batmobile from the 1960s TV series Batman, and pay a visit to Grizzly Adams actor Dan Haggerty's treasure-filled California home.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike is excited to find a rare motorcycle sign, and he and Frank view a collection of oddities stored in a creepy cabin in the woods.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Reality TV show following the exploits of eccentric master fabricator Steve Darnell. This week he and the gang build a Vegas-inspired motor for a flashy client..

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on a race from London's Wembley Stadium to Milan's San Siro, the home of Italian football giants AC and Inter. A price restriction leads Jeremy to grab the keys to a Shelby Mustang GT500, which costs the equivalent of Â£35,000 in America and packs a supercharged punch of more than 650bhp. James and Richard pin their hopes on the pan-European rail network in a bid to secure the prize of tickets to a top-flight football match, with nothing but a long journey home awaiting the losers. On the test track, Jeremy puts Toyota's GT86 coupe through its paces, and its promise of entertaining rear-wheel-drive handling should put a smile on his face. Plus, singer-songwriter Amy Macdonald gets to grips with the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Police officers investigate an attack on a pizza delivery driver and find a woman sleeping in the garden of an abandoned house.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Reality TV show following the exploits of eccentric master fabricator Steve Darnell, who this week revamps a classic 1932 Model B for an old-school client.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson puts the Kia Cee'd through a rigorous but peculiar road test featuring eels, curry, a rock legend, an American police officer and an unusual game of rugby involving James May. Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the Mastretta MXT, but worries about the repercussions of a comment he made in a previous episode about Mexico, the sports car's country of manufacture. Plus, three high-performance hatchbacks are driven with gusto around the test track, and Formula One driver Lewis Hamilton gets a second chance to smash the lap record.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond try to solve the problems that increasingly complex cars pose to an ageing population. They design a vehicle for elderly people and put it to the test in Dorset with the help of three pensioners. Meanwhile, James May gets acquainted with a revamped Range Rover in London before pitting the luxurious off-roader against an autonomous military machine in Nevada. Actor James McAvoy tackles the test track in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended version of the quiz with a difference, with guests Sheila Hancock, Jimmy Carr and Jeremy Clarkson joining regular panellist Alan Davies, focusing on military matters.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Anita Rani, Chris Ramsey, Janet Ellis and Jamie Theakston compete in Double Points Friday, and their scores are tallied from the week resulting in an overall champion being crowned.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Celebrity guests Fern Britton, Richard E Grant, Sanjeev Bhaskar and Martin Clunes join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show in which contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon presents.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Celebrity guests Ruth Jones, Jason Manford, Jack Dee and Peter Serafinowicz join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show, in which contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Alan Carr, Andi Osho and Patrick Kielty
programme.desc: Alan Carr hosts the stand-up show recorded at London's Hammersmith Apollo, inviting comedians to share their light-hearted views on modern life. He introduces routines by Andi Osho and Patrick Kielty.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Jo Brand shows cowboys how to cowboy, Katy Wix tortures Alex Horne with the help of a garden arch and Rose Matafeo asks a stranger if they have a library card.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Mind-boggling comedy quiz show in which Stephen Fry quizzes Alan Davies, Jimmy Carr, Rob Brydon and Bill Bailey for more interesting answers on subjects beginning with the letter E, including engineering.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry quizzes Alan Davies, Jo Brand, Sean Lock and Rich Hall for more interesting answers on subjects beginning with the letter E in the mind-boggling comedy quiz show.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team is under pressure with a record number of cars to auction, but Derek finds room for one more - a replica AC Cobra. A couple are reunited with their Volvo breakdown truck.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A highway built in the Brazilian jungle as an escape route in the event of an emergency at a nuclear power station, a Soviet fortress and Ellis Island hospital.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The longest retreat in British military history, when Allied troops defending Burma in 1942 were confronted by Japanese forces well prepared for jungle warfare. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the US navy's most advanced nuclear submarine - which can remain underwater for months at a time - examining the previous vessels that influenced it.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Nazi Wives
programme.desc: Documentary about the most important women in Hitler's life, and the role women played in the Nazi regime.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The extension of the Panama Canal to accommodate the world's largest ships, which drew inspiration from the work of 17th-century engineer Hugues Cosnier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A highway built in the Brazilian jungle as an escape route in the event of an emergency at a nuclear power station, a Soviet fortress and Ellis Island hospital.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Luftwaffe's bombing raids on Britain's provincial cities, when Coventry and Plymouth were hardest hit, although Portsmouth, Glasgow, Sheffield and Bristol also suffered heavy casualties. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: In Search of the Real King Arthur
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates the truth behind the legend of King Arthur, and looks for evidence of whether the mythical monarch was English, Scottish or Welsh.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The extension of the Panama Canal to accommodate the world's largest ships, which drew inspiration from the work of 17th-century engineer Hugues Cosnier.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team travels down the west of Scotland, through the mountainous terrain of Arran toward the English border at Gretna. En route they pass Prestwick Airport, the impressive mudflats of Solway Firth, and the Ardeer dunes, where 19th-century inventor Alfred Nobel built what was then the world's largest explosives factory. Neil Oliver presents.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston tells the story of Hitler's state executioner, who was placed in charge of killing thousands of people declared enemies of the state.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of wildlife that inhabit remote islands, revealing the advantages and disadvantages of the creatures' habitat. Three-toed sloths in the Caribbean and nesting albatross enjoy a peaceful existence untroubled by predators, but other animals are not so fortunate. Marine iguanas in the Galapagos Islands are preyed on by racer snakes from birth, while penguins on the Antarctic island of Zavodovski risk being battered against the rocks by fierce waves.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team is under pressure with a record number of cars to auction, but Derek finds room for one more - a replica AC Cobra. A couple are reunited with their Volvo breakdown truck.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A highway built in the Brazilian jungle as an escape route in the event of an emergency at a nuclear power station, a Soviet fortress and Ellis Island hospital.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Luftwaffe's bombing raids on Britain's provincial cities, when Coventry and Plymouth were hardest hit, although Portsmouth, Glasgow, Sheffield and Bristol also suffered heavy casualties. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A classic car fan with a love of the Jaguar E-Type reluctantly sends his dream car to auction, hoping to buy a motorhome with the money. Two Ford Escorts get Dave's pulse racing.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The programme looks at a mysterious group of rusting ships stranded in an arid desert, and a monstrous defensive line on the snow-covered peaks of the Italian Alps.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The role played by engineering giant Vickers during the Second World War, including the development of the Spitfire and how the Royal Navy recovered from losing so many warships.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The desert town that faced a disaster of biblical proportions. Plus, scorched remains that speak of imprisonment and torture and vast coastal ruins that reveal a past once wiped from history.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of Whistler on the Canadian Pacific seaboard, a remote mountain town whose creation was made possible with record-breaking engineering equipment, helping establish one of the best ski resorts in the world.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A classic car fan with a love of the Jaguar E-Type reluctantly sends his dream car to auction, hoping to buy a motorhome with the money. Two Ford Escorts get Dave's pulse racing.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Craggy cop Jim Taggart investigates the murder of an undertaker found in a burnt-out car, and soon realises that all the evidence points to local French teacher Francoise Campbell, whose pupils seem strangely anxious to protect her. Whodunit, starring Mark McManus, James MacPherson, Iain Anders and Robert Robertson.

programme.title: Lorna Doone
programme.desc: Lavish adaptation of RD Blackmore's novel of lovers, outlaws and warring families in 17th-century Exmoor. Amelia Warner stars as the eponymous heroine, with Queer as Folk's Aidan Gillen as her evil aristocratic cousin, who wants her for himself at any cost. The cast also includes Richard Coyle, Martin Clunes, Barbara Flynn and Michael Kitchen.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Jack arrives home drunk, Aveline puts her desire for a baby on hold, and Nellie meets her admirer in the park.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits a Japanese-style horticultural haven in St Mawgan, Cornwall - open to the public under the National Gardens Scheme - complete with oriental plants including bamboo and bonsai.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Period medical drama chronicling the personal and professional consequences of Eleanor Bramwell's determined quest to become the first female surgeon at the East London Hospital. Jemma Redgrave stars.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Angela's career causes problems for her and Chris and Major Forrester is forced to make a difficult decision. Starring Fiona Bell and James Callis.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jim makes a partial confession to June about his debts, leaving her in no mood to enjoy her retirement party, preferring to drown her sorrows rather than facing up to the reality of her husband's betrayal. As the booze flows freely, Amber makes a bee-line for Steve and promptly seduces the virginal copper - doubtless setting the scene for plenty of emotional tempests to come. By contrast, Ramani's professionalism impresses Jack so much he puts her in charge of a new Vulnerable Persons Unit.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Jess tells Zubin she is pregnant and moving in with Sean, but is stunned by his reaction, while Tricia is haunted by her failed marriage in the wake of Maggie's death. Mickie's date with Mubbs doesn't go as well as either of them hoped and she decides to face reality, confessing to Will she is gay but urging him to keep it a secret. The Crouches' Mona Hammond guest stars.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Liz has reservations regarding Josh being in the right frame of mind as he returns to work. A glamorous former colleague of Richard's appears on the wards, while Matt's party goes awry as be bids farewell to his colleagues and prepares to head to Crete.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: As June prepares for her final day at Sun Hill, Jim finally comes clean and reveals the full extent of his gambling debts - but far from saving his marriage, the admission causes her to storm off in disgust, swearing to have nothing more to do with him. And just when Jim thinks things couldn't possibly get any worse, the hapless copper is abducted and roughed up by vicious loan shark Zaccadelli. Elsewhere, Yvonne discovers her sister has been attacked at home and suspects Shirley is responsible, while Steve is cock-a-hoop after his night with Amber - but she soon brings him down to earth.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ricky is curious about Sam's secretiveness, Pauline makes plans for her New Zealand trip, Dot fears for the laundrette's future, and Celestine waits for a decision from Etta.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Gill fears that Mark will not be able to cope with the difficult times ahead.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Scase and Tate are both disciplined by Area Commander Bulstrode. Elsewhere, the Blue Watch attend a blaze at the cafe across the road. Starring Sean Blowers and James Marcus.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.sub-title: Three Men and a Brittle Lady
programme.desc: The roguish antiques dealer offers to track down a conman after Charlie is swindled out of a china figurine. He also helps Charlotte find the thieves who've robbed her house. Drama, guest starring Lionel Jeffries and Eve Matheson.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: An actor playing the part of a German commandant in a war film receives death threats from someone evidently still resentful over the island's past Nazi occupation. Warren Clarke guest stars, with John Nettles and Terence Alexander.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Billy wrestles with the prospect of fatherhood as Julie prepares to give birth. A devastated Adrian prepares to visit the unemployment agency, but is reassured by Joey's guidance of such occasions. Comedy, starring Nick Conway, Jonathon Morris and Peter Howitt.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: The staff at Grace Brothers are up in arms when it is decided that those who have reached a certain age are to be made redundant - leaving Mrs Slocombe facing the sack. They are far from appeased when they meet her successor. Comedy, starring Mollie Sugden.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean insists on going back to work having returned from LA, certain she can overcome jet lag, but Lionel just wants to rest. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Auntie Wainwright is thrilled to have picked up a bargain at the auction rooms, but puzzled as to what the object is. Worse yet, when she does find out what her purchase is meant for, she still has no idea what to do with it. Long-running comedy series, starring Jean Alexander, Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: The Murdochs' housewarming party is cut short when a man is cooked to the point of exploding in a closet-sized microwave prototype. Return of the crime drama, starring Yannick Bisson.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A British cop is murdered on the Caribbean island of Saint Marie, and the local commissioner declares another officer from the UK must be flown over to lead the investigation. Enter DI Richard Poole, a brilliant detective with a unique approach to cracking crime, and just the man to solve the mystery of his colleague's death. The only problem is, he is totally unsuited to a life of sun, sea and sand - and worse still, it seems his boss back home wants him to stay there. First episode of the drama, starring Ben Miller, Sara Martins, Lenora Crichlow, Don Warrington, Danny John-Jules and Sean Maguire.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a political activist 15 years earlier but, just as it is getting somewhere, Ted orders the investigation to be halted and Ucos is threatened with closure following its perceived mishandling of the Hanway case. However, the team refuses to give up, and finds evidence of a cover-up involving top officials and a multi-national drugs company. Guest starring Meera Syal and Lorraine Ashbourne.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Two skulls are found during the construction of a new bypass, and the detective investigates a possible link to the theft of poisonous snakes from a Glasgow research laboratory. Drama, starring Mark McManus, Blythe Duff and Dougray Scott.

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: After Will and Leonard witness a deadly and deliberate hit-and-run, Geordie traces the car to a pair of decidedly dysfunctional brothers, whose house lies far off the beaten path. The victim's wife, his employee and the two brothers are all damaged characters caught in a web of lies and betrayals - and it's not just secrets hiding within the siblings' grounds. Back at home, Will and Geordie both struggle as unwelcome guests look set to stay - Will's mum Amelia seems to have found a carbon copy of his late father in her new beau. Meanwhile, a new television set lands in the vicarage - just in time for Eurovision. Robson Green, Tom Brittney and Al Weaver star.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Comedian Rowland Rivron puts on a dinner party at his home as he plays mystery host to four strangers. Presented by Brian McFadden.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: Holidays: Bagging a Bargain Break - Tonight
programme.desc: Helen Skelton presents a report on the tourism industry, asking how easy it will be to get a bargain holiday in 2020 in the aftermath of the Thomas Cook collapse.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Guest panellists engage in topical debate and celebrity interviews from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson is joined by Mark Stevens, Michael Hogben and Alison Chapman in Weston-super-Mare, Somerset, to offer locals the chance to put their items up for auction or accept a cash sum. Mark parts with the pounds to pay for a plane ride, Michael fails to work his magic for some Harry Potter paraphernalia and Alison is as 'divine' as the painting she pays for.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of five friends answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. Vinny, Steph, Simon and Pat work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: In the final instalment set during the opening of Hawkford Outdoor Pursuits, Graham's day unfolds, and a series of flashbacks reveal the truth.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Yasmeen finds Jade lying unconscious in the ginnel, and Fiz looks like the prime suspect. Charlie tells Tim how much cash she wants before she will sign any divorce papers. Bethany discusses career options with Daniel, but he suggests she might be best to leave Weatherfield altogether.

programme.title: The Greek Islands with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Julia visits the glamorous island of Santorini, beginning in one of its most exclusive hotels where she discovers how one of the Aegean's poorest islands became the playground for the rich and famous. Striking away from the bustling crowds, Julia heads inland for a walk on the wild side, hiking through a forager's paradise to the hilltop village of Pyrgos to watch the sun go down. After sampling a local delicacy made from fava beans, she heads out to sea to find out how local fishermen are joining forces with environmentalists to keep Santorini's pristine waters plastic-free.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: The police wonder if Fiz can shed any light on Jade's assault, Daniel panics as he takes Bertie's temperature, and Bernie tells Paul that she is moving on. Meanwhile, Tim's plan to send Charlie on her way doesn't work out as planned when he finds her working at the Rovers.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Will and Ellie go on their first date with a trip to the flicks. However, a scream from the projection booth cuts the romance short as they discover a brutal murder has taken place within the cinema. Geordie arrives to investigate and soon they've found movie star connections, oddball employees and a link to the Asian subcontinent, as a shadowy figure emerges from Jack Chapman's past and refuses to retreat without causing a stir. Cathy's mother takes the children out for the day, which ends up worrying Cathy far more than it should. Robson Green, Tom Brittney, Lauren Carse and Kacey Ainsworth star.

programme.title: Cold Feet
programme.desc: Adam and Karen's new living arrangements cause chaos for the family when an unexpected visitor tips them over the edge. Elsewhere, David embraces his new role, but faces humiliation from a former adversary, while Pete's time on a jury has unexpected consequences for Adam. John Thomson, James Nesbitt, Fay Ripley, Hermione Norris and Robert Bathurst star in Mike Bullen's long-running comedy drama, with guest appearances by Gemma Jones, Clare Keelan and Sunetra Sarker.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Following Trisha Goddard's elimination last week, the remaining 11 celebrities and their professional partners perform routines from famous musicals. They will be hoping to get a high score from judges Jayne Torvill, Christopher Dean, Ashley Banjo and John Barrowman - not to mention plenty of viewer votes - and avoid having to compete in the skate-off. Presented by Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby.

programme.title: Hot Hook Ups: The Friday Rewind
programme.desc: It's Friday which means rewind time. We've got all your favourite collaborations from the biggest stars on the planet; the perfect way to kick off your weekend.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how George Washington's favourite tipple is made, how aircraft seats are tested without crashing a plane, and the manufacturing processes behind billions of batteries.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer travels to Poland to source an FSM Syrena, but with the model being virtually unknown outside of the country, he and Edd China could struggle to make a profit.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini sells four cars at auction in Kissimmee, Florida, but fears they will become lost in a crowd of 2,000 lots.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini sells two cars at Mecum Auctions and cannot resist bidding for vintage jeeps and a Chevy pickup.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A tornado smashes into 40 houses, a massive explosion occurs at a propane plant, a truck crashes into a bridge resulting in a collapse, and a drag boat crashes.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Footage of a train accident that led to huge explosions, a wall collapsing on top of firefighters, planes colliding on an aircraft carrier, a race-car crash and a sinking pier.

programme.title: Extreme Loggers
programme.desc: The lumberjacks of Pine Ridge Logging endure extreme temperatures and the risk of frostbite as they finish their work in the forests of northern Alberta, Canada.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: The team transforms a man's 1957 Corvette, which has been sitting in the garage for years, waiting to be made roadworthy again.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Examining how the street lamps of Venice are cast, and how tiny trees are grown for the ancient Chinese art of penjing.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: The restoration team transforms a shabby set of apothecary drawers, refreshes a French Victorian seat and saves a 1960s chandelier that witnessed a Beatle's wedding.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The red king crab season gets under way once more, and the trawlers prepare for the weeks of toil ahead. However, events take a dramatic turn when an emergency distress signal sounds throughout the fishing fleet.

programme.title: Gold Divers: Under the Ice
programme.desc: Three teams of miners embark on a search for the precious metal under 4ft of solid ice on the floor of the Bering Sea between Russia and Alaska.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Steve Grahame receives a double dose of bad luck during a brutal lap through the red centre. Plus, Turbo is back, battling to get his business out of a rut.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China struggle to agree on the definition of a real sports car, prompting Mike to head out in search of the perfect example - bringing home a 1968 Corvette.

programme.title: Supertruckers
programme.desc: Janet, Matt and Chelsea Paul shift a fleet of armoured cars between army bases. Steve and Sam have to negotiate the capital's traffic to deliver a crane near the London Stadium.

programme.title: Secrets of the Underground
programme.desc: When an infamous pirate city sunk into the sea, a huge treasure may have gone with it. Could cutting edge technology reveal its resting place?.

programme.title: Railroad Australia
programme.desc: Bernie's coal truck odyssey goes horribly wrong. Two veteran locomotives risk destruction in a race for glory, and a mega-train faces the steepest grades in Australia. Documentary shedding light on the work of railway staff responsible for transporting train passengers through the blistering heat of the vast Australian wilderness.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The fishing fleet looks for survivors when a boat sinks. The search leads to the rescue of one man, along with the recovery of two bodies, while another crewman is declared lost at sea.

programme.title: Gold Divers: Under the Ice
programme.desc: A fire aboard the Shamrock forces diver Vincent to make an emergency ascent, while Emma tries to adapt to the challenges of ice diving.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a Victorian folly in Devon, where some ghoulish buys shock his wife. Plus, premium prices at an antique emporium in London cause trouble.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Graham's race through the desert takes a sudden turn, while it is hard rock and hard knocks on an urgent run to the races for young trucker Will.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer travels to Poland to source an FSM Syrena, but with the model being virtually unknown outside of the country, he and Edd China could struggle to make a profit.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: The artisan restorers revive a rare and valuable fairground ride, then resuscitate a Victorian park bench and a century-old gentleman's suitcase.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits some family-run businesses in Lincolnshire and Norfolk in the hope of finding rare and unusual antiques that have never been put on sale before.

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: A team of international investigators conducts a definitive inquiry into the possibility that Adolf Hitler may have survived the conclusion of the Second World War, and escaped from Germany before he could be apprehended by Allied forces. The investigation is inspired by an FBI cold case from 70 years ago, which saw top US officials, including FBI director J Edgar Hoover, considering the possibility that the German Fuhrer's death may have been fabricated to give him a chance to flee from justice.

programme.title: Treasure Quest: Snake Island
programme.desc: A vital clue on Snake Island pushes the treasure hunters to enter the perilous Paraguayan jungle, and a historic artefact brings them closer to a valuable find.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how nickel is mined, how the lock gates for canals are built so that barges and boats can climb hills, and the processes involved in creating Taiwan's beloved bubble tea.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How skyline logging sources Vancouver's most elusive trees. Plus, how ordinary clay is transformed into intricate tiles in a Spanish workshop.

programme.title: 10 Steps to Murder
programme.desc: Detectives, friends and family reveal the twists and turns that led to tragedy, and where it all went wrong - revealing the 10 steps to murder..

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How toxicologists search for hidden clues in blood and tissue to bring murders to light, including the case of a wife poisoned by cyanide.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: How the demonic themes of The Omen resonated with Sean Sellers, a fam who was inspired to re-enact the character of Damien.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: How the double homicide of a young mother and her baby daughter sent Galax's tiny police force on a frenzied mission to stop unspeakable evil in its tracks.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The case of a businessman who flew to Florida to make a million-dollar deal but was never seen again, leaving the FBI with few leads to follow.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: A puppy that was attacked with a machete is rescued, prompting members of the team to investigate who was responsible for the crime.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Sydney vet Dr Chris Brown attempts to help a lady who runs a shelter for abandoned donkeys. Lisa takes on a six-year-old apprentice who has arrived at Sash with her sick dog, Jelly.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Country music star Kristian Bush helps a bride choose a dress, and a customer is nervous that her dress will be too small for her.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: If You've Got It, Flaunt It
programme.desc: Embracing her height, pro-basketball player Kia looks for a long dress to complement her six-inch heels.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A customer invites her fiance's ex-girlfriend to the salon, and while Tracy wants a short dress, her partner would prefer her to have a long gown.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown deals with Fergus, the accident-prone dog, and Brian, the bulldog who is struggling to breathe. Tim attempts to tackle some runaway sheep.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The investigators revisit animals from previous rescues to get updates on their progress.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The team checks up on the progress of a group of bears and tigers rescued from a chicken shed.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades takes on an interesting challenge with some forgotten fish tanks, while Kev Paxton looks to find a functional use for an old trampoline.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Scientists use forensic evidence to piece together the stories of soldiers who went to war but never returned.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: A case in which an attractive, young woman moved to the US for a new opportunity, only to vanish without a trace a few weeks later. Previous kidnapping survivor Elizabeth Smart joined in the search.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 21-year-old party animal Kortne Stouffer, who vanished from her Pennsylvania apartment in July 2012 after rowing with neighbours and friends.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Katie's sister persuades her to ditch the tomboy look, Courtney searches for a ball gown and Jennifer orders a dress too small for her to make her lose weight.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Amy bought a gown elsewhere, before changing her mind, and now she is hunting for her dream dress, while Michelle views her outfit after losing more than three stone.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Jacqueline goes in search of two dresses of different styles for her wedding, while Christina arrives for her second fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride Tara shops with Olympic figure skater and fashionista Johnny Weir, while Taylor brings her fiance Austin to help her find her dream gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: New to wedding dress shopping, Farrah does not seem to know what she wants, while Stephanie's style is vintage glam and she has a clear idea of what to go for.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Natalie is hoping Kleinfeld's will be the last stop on her bridal gown tour, while Amy has lost five stone but still sees herself as overweight.

programme.title: Being Reuben
programme.desc: Reuben attends a major press party on his last night in New York. However, nerves set in as he must give a speech in front of the city's biggest beauty bloggers.

programme.title: Being Reuben
programme.desc: Reuben does some work experience with his granfather in Bampa's old doughnut van. Later, at London Fashion Week. they meet up with make-up star, The Plastic Boy.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a dealer specialising in house clearances, and in Sheffield spots industrial furniture at a 19th-century factory. Later, he finds old punk collectable.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades takes on an interesting challenge with some forgotten fish tanks, while Kev Paxton looks to find a functional use for an old trampoline.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: A woman tries to lose enough weight to qualify for skin removal surgery, while a patient at a Beverly Hills clinic finds her treatment tougher than expected.

programme.title: Murder Made Me Famous
programme.desc: The conviction of charismatic Chicago policeman Drew Peterson, in relation to the 2003 death of his third wife Kathleen Savio. His fourth wife Stacy Peterson disappeared four years later, and remains missing.

programme.title: Dr G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: The doctor tries to piece together the evidence that will determine exactly what happened when a 43-year-old man took a nap at his parents' house, and was later found dead in bed. Plus, a 53-year-old woman found dead on her sofa.

programme.title: The Detectives: My Killer Case
programme.desc: Disturbing crimes from across the UK are unpacked and retold in intimate detail through police files, CCTV footage and accounts from those who helped solve them..
